intro: Pedicularis subulatidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hair-like leaves and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats where it derives some nutrients from its host plants. Due to its specialized growth conditions, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
